beginnerTopics.title: Introduction to HTML: The Language of the Web
beginnerTopics.content: HTML, or Hypertext Markup Language, is the foundational language of the World Wide Web...

beginnerTopics.content:

In this example, clicking 'Visit Example Website' will take the user to https://www.example.com.
Images are embedded in HTML using the tag. The src attribute is required to specify the path to the image file...
The alt attribute is essential for accessibility and SEO, providing text that describes the image for users who cannot see it or when the image fails to load.
Forms in HTML allow users to input data that can be submitted to a server for processing...

<form action="/submit-form" method="POST">
  <!-- Form inputs go here -->
</form>
The action attribute specifies where to send the form data, and the method attribute defines how to send it (POST or GET).
Form Inputs: Text Fields and Buttons
Text fields allow users to enter text, and buttons are used to submit the form or reset fields.

<input type="text" name="username" placeholder="Enter your username">
<button type="submit">Submit</button>
In this example, a text input field is created with a placeholder, and a submit button is used to submit the form.
